content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Two blocks are on a horizontal tabletop, as shown in the figure. Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> is initially moving with speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to the right toward Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, which is initially at rest. The blocks can slide with negligible friction on the tabletop, which is a height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> above the floor. The blocks collide and stick together, moving to the right and beyond the edge of the table. The blocks remain together as they fall to the floor, landing with their center of mass a horizontal distance <math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> from the table’s edge. Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is then returned to its initial position, and Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is replaced with Block <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. Block <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> has mass <math alttext="2 m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and is given an initial speed <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> to the right. As before, the blocks collide, stick together, and remain together as they fall to the floor. Blocks <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> land with their center of mass a horizontal distance <math alttext="delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math> from the table’s edge. (a) Indicate the correct relation between <math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math>._____<math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub, is greater than delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="delta x sub B C, end sub, is greater than delta x sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub, equals delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math>Justify your selection.

frqParts.text: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Two blocks are on a horizontal tabletop, as shown in the figure. Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> is initially moving with speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to the right toward Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, which is initially at rest. The blocks can slide with negligible friction on the tabletop, which is a height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> above the floor. The blocks collide and stick together, moving to the right and beyond the edge of the table. The blocks remain together as they fall to the floor, landing with their center of mass a horizontal distance <math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> from the table’s edge. Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is then returned to its initial position, and Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is replaced with Block <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. Block <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> has mass <math alttext="2 m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and is given an initial speed <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> to the right. As before, the blocks collide, stick together, and remain together as they fall to the floor. Blocks <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> land with their center of mass a horizontal distance <math alttext="delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math> from the table’s edge. (a) Indicate the correct relation between <math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math>._____<math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub, is greater than delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="delta x sub B C, end sub, is greater than delta x sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></math>_____<math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub, equals delta x sub B C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math>Justify your selection.

(b) Starting with the conservation of momentum, derive an expression for <math alttext="delta x sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate. Assume that the time during which the blocks are only partially beyond the table’s edge and still partially on table is negligible.
(c) Indicate whether the expression you derived in part (b) is consistent with the relation you selected in part (a). Justify your answer.

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
